intro: Trichostema austromontanum subsp. austromontanum, commonly known as the mountain bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which are typical of the Plantaginaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in native plant gardens.
